original: la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba dang ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba
analyzed: la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba dang ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba
translated: Having removed the two shoes, one should sit in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same view and has the same characteristics, who is within the boundaries, and who is of a different name and class than oneself, and with palms joined

analyzed: btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang rigs gang byung ba smos te cig car mthol ba dang bshags pa byar rung ngo //

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra for that is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /üîΩbdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas byung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas byung ste /
translated: Venerable, please heed me.üîΩFor me, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, a fault arose from the class of downfalls that result in defeat, from the application of such-and-such an application.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo 'chags so //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, disclose that downfall in the presence of the venerable. I do not conceal it. I confess it.

original: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: If I do not confess them, I will not.

original: nyan pa pos ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyan pa pos ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúDo you see your downfall?‚Äù

original: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúWill you refrain from it in the future?‚Äù The one confessing says, ‚ÄúI will refrain.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúThat is the method.‚Äù The one confessing says, ‚ÄúExcellent.‚Äù

original: de tsam gyis na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By that much, one rises from the downfall.

original: de'i mod la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i mod la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If at that moment there is no person to whom one can confess, there is no fault in concealing it until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //

translated: As long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, even if the dawn has broken, there is no fault of concealment for not confessing.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ji srid du gang la @49a * //
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ji srid du gang la @49a * //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess,

original: mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: as long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, there is no fault of concealment for not having the intention to confess.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if for some reason one does not have the opportunity to go there,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one has gone from that place to another, there is no fault of concealment for not having the intention to confess in the meantime.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro ba'am gzhan du song bas
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro ba'am gzhan du song bas
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one confesses, if one thinks, ‚ÄúIf I go to them and do not confess, I will incur the fault of concealment,‚Äù one does not go to them or one goes elsewhere.

original: brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault of concealment in not confessing.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang gzhan du 'gro ba dang skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang gzhan du 'gro ba dang skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
translated: Not going to them, going elsewhere, not confessing before dawn and generating the thought of concealment are all faults.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol
translated: If the person to whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is natural, has similar views and is within the same boundary, if the downfalls are similar in name and type, then one confesses to a single Dharma follower.

original: la / de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: la / de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: After that, a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature, whose view and name are the same, who is within the same boundary, should confess in the presence of a monk whose downfalls are of the same name and type.

original: ltung ba ming las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ming las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: If there is no person whose downfalls are of the same name, he should confess in the presence of a monk whose downfalls are of the same type.

original: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, name refers to the class of downfalls.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: Type refers to the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
translated: A person of this Dharma refers to a fully ordained monk, one who has received the precepts, a fully ordained nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay practitioner, a female lay practitioner, a layperson who has the view of the TathƒÅgata, who is within the same boundary,

original: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan gyi nang na 'dug pa dag go //
analyzed: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan gyi nang na 'dug pa dag go //
translated: and one whose view is different, who is within another boundary.

original: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni /üîΩmtshan mi mthun par bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas @49b su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni / mtshan mi mthun par bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas @49b su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Here is the presentation of those.üîΩIf one confesses to those who have different characteristics than oneself, it is not concealment, but a wrong action.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to those who are not fully ordained, it is not concealment, but a wrong action.

original: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to those who are not fully ordained, it is not concealment, but a wrong action.

original: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one confesses to any of those who are Dharma practitioners, but who are in a different region or have a different view, it is not concealment,

original: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: but a wrong action.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is not in his normal state, it is not concealment, but a wrong action.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las /üîΩmthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las / mthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature confesses a downfall that is similar in name and type to a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature and who is in agreement with him regarding views and attributes and who is within the same boundary, then he does not conceal the downfall, but he does commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun par mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun par mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature confesses a downfall that is not similar in name and type to a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature and who is in agreement with him regarding views and attributes and who is within the same boundary, then he does not conceal the downfall, nor does he commit a downfall.

original: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the other downfalls that follow.

original: ltung ba mthol bal spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba mthol bal spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: The general presentation of the confession of downfalls is completed by the recitation of the confession formula.

original: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire confession formula, then one should at least make oneself understood by reciting the name or the type of downfall that one has committed.

original: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so //üîΩnyes byas mthol ba las ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so // nyes byas mthol ba las ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /

original: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //üîΩpham par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo // pham par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
translated: In confessing a fault, it is sufficient to make it known in some way, without mentioning the name and type of offense, by saying, ‚ÄúI have incurred a downfall,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done something wrong.‚ÄùüîΩIn all cases of downfalls other than the actual basis of a defeating offense, if there is concealment, the previously incurred fault of concealment should be amended first, and then the downfall itself should be recognized as something to be amended.

original: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid bcabs pa de gnyis je mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid bcabs pa de gnyis je mthol bar bya'o //
translated: The amendment of the fault of concealment is to confess both the downfall and the concealment for as long as it has been concealed.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
translated: For a residual offense, if there is a fault of concealment, it must be removed by a rite called probation.

original: de ni 'og nas ston to //üîΩmthol ba dang @50a * //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas ston to // mthol ba dang @50a * //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not confess or reveal a downfall while there is an opportunity to do so, one commits an occasional offense.

original: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
translated: If the person to whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is natural, has similar views and is within the boundaries, but the name and type of the downfall are not the same, one should not confess to another who is a follower of this doctrine.

original: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
translated: Confession should never be done to another who is a follower of this doctrine.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba nyes pa sbom po'i phyir bcos pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba las bslang ba ste /

translated: The amendment of the serious offense that is the basis for a defeating offense is to be lifted by both confession and revelation.

original: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma tho ba bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma tho ba bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: Confession is that a monk should not conceal a downfall.üîΩIf he commits a serious or slight offense that is a precursor to any of the four defeating offenses, he should not conceal it even for a single moment.

analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba bzhi po sbyor ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba dang yang ba gang yang rung ba byung ba na bcab pa'i sems cig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mdo la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang
translated: In the sutra itself, the monk should remove his two sandals,üîΩkneel before a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his nature, who is of the same view and the same class order, who is within the same boundary, and who has not committed a downfall of the same name and class,

original: byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o ;
analyzed: byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o ;
translated: bow with palms joined, and confess the downfall by stating the name of the class of downfall and the type of downfall that occurred.

original: / de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: / de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formula for this is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable ones, please listen.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po byung ste /

analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //

original: mi 'chab bo //

original: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /

original: ma mthol na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /

analyzed: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
translated: By that much, it is a confession.

original: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If at that very moment there is no person to whom one should confess, there is no offense of concealment until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do//
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do//
translated: As long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, even if the dawn has broken, there is no fault of concealing the transgression.

original: @50b gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: @50b gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess, as long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, there is no fault of concealing the transgression, since there is no thought of confessing.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if for some reason one does not have the opportunity to go there,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one goes from that place to another, there is no fault of concealing the transgression, since there is no thought of confessing in the meantime.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song lam brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song lam brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if the one who has incurred a downfall thinks, ‚ÄúIf I go to him and tell him, I will incur the fault of concealment,‚Äù he does not go to him.

original: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, if he goes to another person and does not tell him, he does not incur the fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal par de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal par de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If he does not go to him because of any circumstance, or goes to another person, or does not confess before dawn, or generates the thought of concealment, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mtholüîΩna yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mthol na yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
translated: If one confesses to a fellow Buddhist who is not of the same class or name, it is still a confession.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The way to set up the confession is the same as before.

original: ltung ba mthol ba sngar bstan pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba sngar bstan pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The confession of the downfall is the same as before.

original: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //üîΩmthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na yang tha na ming ngam /
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o // mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na yang tha na ming ngam /
translated: One should complete the confession mantra.üîΩIf one is unable to recite the entire confession mantra, then even if one makes oneself understood by saying just the name

original: rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
translated: or class of the downfall, it is still a confession.

original: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, the name of the downfall is the class of downfall.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: The class of the downfall is the downfall that has occurred.

original: de ltar ltung ba'i sbyor ba mthol na sbyor ba des sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba'i sbyor ba mthol na sbyor ba des sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
translated: If one confesses the preparation for such a downfall, one does not need to confess the misdeed of the preparation separately.

original: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po'i lci ba ni mtshams gang na dge slong drug yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /üîΩgang na dge slong drug tu ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags @51a * //
analyzed: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po'i lci ba ni mtshams gang na dge slong drug yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste / gang na dge slong drug tu ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags @51a * //
translated: Having thus confessed, the heavy offense of a serious violation that leads to expulsion must be confessed to all the fully ordained monks who are staying in the same region and who have not withdrawn themselves from the confession ceremony.

original: su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to confess it in a place where there are not at least six fully ordained monks.

original: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te drug yan chang du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te drug yan chang du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
translated: If, in such a place, other fully ordained monks are invited and the number of six or more is reached, it is suitable to confess it.

original: dge slong drug yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge slong drug yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste /
translated: If there are six or more fully ordained monks staying in a place, but other fully ordained monks are not present,

original: drug yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su rung ste ;
analyzed: drug yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su rung ste ;
translated: it is also suitable to confess it in a place where six or more fully ordained monks have withdrawn themselves from the confession ceremony.

original: drug yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed cig gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so /
analyzed: drug yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed cig gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so /
translated: One must confess it to all the fully ordained monks who are staying in that place, no matter how many there are.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams gang na dge slong bzhi yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams gang na dge slong bzhi yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
translated: The heavy, grave, defeat-like offense is confessed to all the fully ordained monks who are not excluded from the ceremony and who are present in the region where there are at least four fully ordained monks.

original: gang na dge slong bzhir ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang na dge slong bzhir ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to confess in a region where there are not at least four fully ordained monks.

original: der gnas gzhan nas dag slong dag gnyer te bzhi yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: der gnas gzhan nas dag slong dag gnyer te bzhi yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
translated: In that case, if other fully ordained monks are invited from another region and the number of fully ordained monks becomes at least four, it is suitable to confess.

original: dge slong bzhi yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste bzhi yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong bzhi yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste bzhi yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su mi rung ste /
translated: If in a region where there are at least four fully ordained monks, another fully ordained monk is left out and the number of fully ordained monks becomes at least four, it is not suitable to confess.

original: bzhi yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bzhi yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
translated: In that case, it is necessary to confess to all the fully ordained monks who are present in that region.

original: des na pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong drug la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong drug la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the heavy, grave, defeat-like offense is confessed only in the presence of all the fully ordained monks in the region, at least six in number.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol yang rung ste /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol yang rung ste /
translated: The serious offense that is a downfall is heavy if committed in the inner boundary or outer boundary of a monastery.

original: dge slong bzhi la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags su yang rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong bzhi la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags su yang rung ngo //
translated: It is light if committed in the presence of all four or more fully ordained monks.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba dang yang ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba dang yang ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is the heavy or light of the serious offense that is a downfall to be understood?

original: kha na mtho ba che ba ni lci ba yin la /
analyzed: kha na mtho ba che ba ni lci ba yin la /
translated: The great offense is heavy.

original: kha na mtho ba chung ba ni yang ba yin te /
analyzed: kha na mtho ba chung ba ni yang ba yin te /
translated: The small offense is light.

original: kha na ma tho ba che ba dang chung ba nyid ni yul dang bsam pa shas che chung nyid las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba che ba dang chung ba nyid ni yul dang bsam pa shas che chung nyid las shes par bya ste /
translated: The great and small offenses are known from the greater or lesser strength of the object and the attitude.

original: dper na bsten du mi rung ba dang nyams pa la rtsol ba ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na bsten du mi rung ba dang nyams pa la rtsol ba ni yang ba yin la /
translated: For example, it is light to strive to disrobe one who is unsuitable to be a monk or to disrobe one who has degenerated.

original: de bzhin du rtsa dang phub ma la sogs pa rku ba yang yang ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa dang phub ma la sogs pa rku ba yang yang ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, it is light to steal grass, straw and so on.

original: sprul pa gsod pa dang skra can 'tshong ba dag kyang yang ba yin /
analyzed: sprul pa gsod pa dang skra can 'tshong ba dag kyang yang ba yin /
translated: It is light to kill a magical being and to sell one's hair.

original: nor pa dang gzhogs smos byed pas brdzun smra ba la sogs pa yang yang ba yin no //
analyzed: nor pa dang gzhogs smos byed pas brdzun smra ba la sogs pa yang yang ba yin no //
translated: Lying, etc. are light when one errs or speaks in jest.

original: bsten du rung ba dang ma nyams par bcug la reg pa nyams su myong ba ni lci ba yin la /
analyzed: bsten du rung ba dang ma nyams par bcug la reg pa nyams su myong ba ni lci ba yin la /
translated: It is heavy when one is fit to be relied upon, when one is not impaired, when one touches, and when one experiences.

original: de bzhin du yan lag ma tshang ba'i rdzas mang po rku ba yang lci ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag ma tshang ba'i rdzas mang po rku ba yang lci ba yin /
translated: Similarly, it is heavy to steal many things that are not complete.

original: gsod pa la 'jug pa dang @51b du len pa la sogs pa yang lci ba yin /
analyzed: gsod pa la 'jug pa dang @51b du len pa la sogs pa yang lci ba yin /
translated: It is heavy to engage in killing, to accept it, and so on.

original: rdul khrod kyi sha za zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan la sogs pa yang lci ba yin no //
analyzed: rdul khrod kyi sha za zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan la sogs pa yang lci ba yin no //
translated: It is heavy to kill a flesh eating rakshasa ghost, to kill one who is in meditative serenity, to kill one who is a reason for meditative serenity, and so on.üîΩThe ritual of confessing the heavy and grave offenses that are grounds for defeat and the mantra are as follows:

original: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spom po lci ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa drug yan
analyzed: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spom po lci ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa drug yan
translated: Within the confines of the monastery, six fully ordained monks who are of the same view and have similar characteristics, but whose names and lineages are not the same, should gather.

original: chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: The monks who have gathered should remove their sandals, put their upper robes over one shoulder, and pay respect to the senior monks.

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting in a squatting position in front of the senior monks, they should bow with palms together and say:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerables, please listen.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba byung ste /
translated: I, monk so-and-so, have committed a serious offense, a grave offense that is a downfall, arising from such-and-such an action in the class of offenses that result in defeat.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du 'chags so //
translated: I, monk so-and-so, confess that offense in the presence of the venerables.

original: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum du bzlas /

analyzed: nyan pa rnams las rgan pa gcig gis ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /

analyzed: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o ;

original: / nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: / nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one who has seen it should say, ‚ÄúI will restrain myself.‚Äù

original: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: After that, the listener should say, ‚ÄúThis is the method.‚Äù

analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: de tsam gyis na pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By just this, one rises from the heavy offense of a partial defeat.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang ngam phyi rol du yang rung ste /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang ngam phyi rol du yang rung ste /

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs mi mthun pa bzhi yan chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs mi mthun pa bzhi yan chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: The fully ordained monks who are present, who are of the same view and the same name and class of offense, should gather together. They should remove their sandals, put their upper robes over one shoulder, and pay respect to the senior monks.

analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: They should sit down in a squatting position in front of the senior monks, bow down with palms together, and say the following:

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag @52a * //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerables,

analyzed: dgongs su gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba byung ste /
translated: please give this to consideration.üîΩI, monk so-and-so, have committed a serious offense that is a downfall due to a transgression of the rules entailing expulsion, which is of such and such a type, and which I have acquired through such and such an action.

analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du 'chags so //

original: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum du bzlas /

analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sngom mam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listeners should say, ‚ÄúWill you restrain yourself from now on?‚Äù

translated: and the one who has the downfall should say, ‚ÄúI will restrain myself.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Then the listeners should say, ‚ÄúThis is the method.‚Äù

analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: and the one who has the downfall should say, ‚ÄúIt is good.‚Äù

translated: When one is stealing in order to obtain a share, one has stolen when one has understood the path of the thieves.

original: sa gzhi dang khang khyim dag brtsig pa la sogs pas bskor te rku ba la ni bskor ba'i mtshams 'byor na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang khang khyim dag brtsig pa la sogs pas bskor te rku ba la ni bskor ba'i mtshams 'byor na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing by surrounding, for example, by building walls and houses, one has stolen when one has surrounded the land.

original: shags kyis rku ba la ni gal te bla'i grar ni rgyal na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: shags kyis rku ba la ni gal te bla'i grar ni rgyal na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing by wagering, one has stolen when one has won the bet.

original: 'og gzu ni pha rol pos sbyor ba nyid btang na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og gzu ni pha rol pos sbyor ba nyid btang na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing by means of a scale, one has stolen when the adversary has let go of the scale.

original: gdub kor la sogs pa bshig ste rku ba la ni bshig ste gnas nas spos na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gdub kor la sogs pa bshig ste rku ba la ni bshig ste gnas nas spos na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing by breaking, for example, a bracelet, one has stolen when one has broken it and moved it from its place.

original: lhung ba rku ba la ni de las khyer na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: lhung ba rku ba la ni de las khyer na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing what has fallen, one has stolen when one has taken it from there.

original: 'dzag pa dang 'brul bar byed pa rku ba la ni bu ga nas byung ba na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzag pa dang 'brul bar byed pa rku ba la ni bu ga nas byung ba na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one is stealing what trickles or oozes, one has stolen when it has come out of a hole.

original: rkun po du ma blo gros mi mthun pa yin na rang gi bgo skal thob pa na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: rkun po du ma blo gros mi mthun pa yin na rang gi bgo skal thob pa na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When there are many thieves with different ideas, one has stolen when one has obtained one‚Äôs share.

original: bdag po'i mngon sum du rku ba la ni mig snga nas mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i mngon sum du rku ba la ni mig snga nas mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If one steals in the presence of the owner, then the theft is complete when the object is outside the range of the owner's sight and the thief is outside the range of his sight.

original: mi'i mthus rku ba la ni dbang du byas pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: mi'i mthus rku ba la ni dbang du byas pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If one steals by the power of a human, then the theft is complete when the object is outside the range of the owner's sight and the thief is outside the range of his sight.üîΩThe presentation of the downfall of preparation:

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni nom par byed nyug par byed la ji srid du gnas nas gnas gzhan du ni spo bar mi byed kyi bar du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni nom par byed nyug par byed la ji srid du gnas nas gnas gzhan du ni spo bar mi byed kyi bar du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one does not move the object from its basis, one has a serious downfall.

original: rang gi dang mi'i ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes med pa dang rin thang ma tshang ba dang gnas nas ma spos pa na nyes par spom po'o ;
analyzed: rang gi dang mi'i ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes med pa dang rin thang ma tshang ba dang gnas nas ma spos pa na nyes par spom po'o ;
translated: If it is not one's own, or one does not perceive it as such, or one does not perceive its value, or one does not move it from its basis, one has a serious downfall.

original: / bdag po med pa'i brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //üîΩ'gro ba gzhan gyi brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: / bdag po med pa'i brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o // 'gro ba gzhan gyi brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals what is not owned by anyone, one has a serious downfall.üîΩIf one steals what belongs to another type of being, one has a serious downfall.

original: rang gi la 'gro ba gzhan gyi 'du shes te brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: rang gi la 'gro ba gzhan gyi 'du shes te brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals what belongs to oneself but perceives it as belonging to another, one has a serious downfall.

original: bdag gir ma byas par spa ba dang / chud gsan pa dang zin pa dang btang ba la sogs pa bral bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas par spa ba dang / chud gsan pa dang zin pa dang btang ba la sogs pa bral bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals what is not appropriated, or what has been lost, or what has been forgotten, or what has been taken up, or what has been given up, it is a serious downfall.

original: shags kyis rku ba 'og gzu'i grar rgyal na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: shags kyis rku ba 'og gzu'i grar rgyal na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals through gambling, it is a serious downfall.

original: chung ba nyid kyis rin thang gdab tu mi chog pa brkus na nyes pa sdom po'o //
analyzed: chung ba nyid kyis rin thang gdab tu mi chog pa brkus na nyes pa sdom po'o //
translated: If one steals what is of little value, it is a serious downfall.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dag gi rdzas brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //üîΩphung @59a * //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dag gi rdzas brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o // phung @59a * //
translated: If one steals the property of those who have no owner, such as the people of Uttarakuru, it is a serious downfall.üîΩIf one steals the property of those who have entered the stream, it is a serious downfall.

original: po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid yin pas de'i dkor brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid yin pas de'i dkor brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals the property of those who have attained nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa, it is a serious downfall, because they are gods of complete purity.

original: brnyan pa nges par sbyin pa bzhin du nye bar spyod na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: brnyan pa nges par sbyin pa bzhin du nye bar spyod na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one uses the property of the Sangha as if it were one‚Äôs own, it is a serious downfall.

original: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis 'bul du bcug na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis 'bul du bcug na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals through the use of spells and medicines, it is a serious downfall.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid du rku na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid du rku na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals for the sake of another, it is a serious offense.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba la bdag la bdag dbang ba'i rtog pas bdag gir byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //üîΩbdams te bzang po rku bar 'dod pas 'dom par byed na nom pa dang nyug pa'i sbom po las gzhan pa'i nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba la bdag la bdag dbang ba'i rtog pas bdag gir byed na nyes pa sbom po'o // bdams te bzang po rku bar 'dod pas 'dom par byed na nom pa dang nyug pa'i sbom po las gzhan pa'i nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one appropriates what is owned by another, thinking that it is one's own, it is a serious offense.üîΩIf one is about to steal something good, having examined it, it is a serious offense, other than the serious offenses of examining and touching.

original: rgyan la dor byed na rku ba la sbyor ba yin pas gal te rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur pa'i tshe nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: rgyan la dor byed na rku ba la sbyor ba yin pas gal te rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur pa'i tshe nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one is about to steal jewelry, since one is preparing to steal, if one does not actually steal it, it is a serious offense.

original: grangs la dor byas nas de'i 'og tu thob par rtsol na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: grangs la dor byas nas de'i 'og tu thob par rtsol na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one is about to steal a certain number of things, and then strives to obtain more than that, it is a serious offense.

original: shod thabs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma phyis pa dang ; bsnan pa dang gnas gzhan du bzhag nas de'i 'og tu thob pa rtsol na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: shod thabs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma phyis pa dang ; bsnan pa dang gnas gzhan du bzhag nas de'i 'og tu thob pa rtsol na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one erases or adds marks such as a notch, or places them elsewhere, and then strives to obtain more than that, it is a serious offense.

original: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dang gtams pa rnams bsnyon na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dang gtams pa rnams bsnyon na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one denies having been accused of contempt, deceit, or fraud, it is a serious offense.

original: su la yang phan par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sgyid pa gcod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: su la yang phan par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sgyid pa gcod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one commits suicide or kills another person for the purpose of not benefiting anyone, it is a serious offense.

original: mtshams kyi nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one smuggles goods through the sky above the border, it is a serious offense.

original: sbyor ba'i tshe na rku sems yod pa la gnas sbed pa'i tshe na rku sems med na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshe na rku sems yod pa la gnas sbed pa'i tshe na rku sems med na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one has the intention to steal at the time of preparation, but not at the time of concealment, it is a serious offense.

original: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dkor brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dkor brkus na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals property belonging to the sa·πÖgha of the four directions, it is a serious offense.

original: gshed ma dang bkren pa la sogs pas yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas len na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gshed ma dang bkren pa la sogs pas yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas len na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one takes from a charnel ground that is guarded by executioners, the poor, and so on, it is a serious offense.

original: gsang sngags kyis rtsa ba la sogs pa skam par byed pas chud gzon na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyis rtsa ba la sogs pa skam par byed pas chud gzon na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one squanders water by drying up a spring and so on through mantra and so on, it is a serious offense.

original: dud 'gro rku ba'i phyir chas kyis brjod pa dang zhon te brku'o snyam pas lus 'gyur ba byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro rku ba'i phyir chas kyis brjod pa dang zhon te brku'o snyam pas lus 'gyur ba byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one makes physical changes with the intention to steal an animal, whether it is tethered or not, it is a serious offense.

original: gru la yang gru 'dir zhugs te brku'o snyam pas lus 'gyur bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gru la yang gru 'dir zhugs te brku'o snyam pas lus 'gyur bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one makes a gesture with one's body, thinking, I will steal this boat, it is a serious offense.

original: gru 'di las rdzas 'di ltar brku'o snyam nas lus 'gyur bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gru 'di las rdzas 'di ltar brku'o snyam nas lus 'gyur bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one makes a gesture with one's body, thinking, I will steal this object from the boat, it is a serious offense.

original: pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod @59b rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la bsngos pa la sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod @59b rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la bsngos pa la sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one conceals the duty to pay a toll that is owed to one's parents, siblings, children, grandchildren, preceptor, teacher, a stupa, the community, and so on, it is a serious offense.

original: gzhan la byin pa tshu rol pos mi shes pa bar du bcabs na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gzhan la byin pa tshu rol pos mi shes pa bar du bcabs na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one conceals the fact that one has given something to another person, it is a serious offense.

original: yongs su bzung ba la yongs su bzung bar 'du shes na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba la yongs su bzung bar 'du shes na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one conceals the fact that one has taken something that is owned, it is a serious offense.

original: bsod snyoms mi dbang ba nod na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms mi dbang ba nod na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one accepts alms that are not permitted, it is a serious offense.

original: rku ba'i ched du gros byed na nyis pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: rku ba'i ched du gros byed na nyis pa sbom po'o //
translated: If one conspires for the sake of stealing, it is a serious offense.

original: dge slong 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes med pa la nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes med pa la nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If a monk assumes the manner of another sect, and does not have the perception of being a monk, it is a serious offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed byas pa re re la yang nyes pa sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed byas pa re re la yang nyes pa sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: For each of the many different preparations for the actual basis, there is one serious fault.üîΩThe downfall through preparation is defined as follows:

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni khri las ldang ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni khri las ldang ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: From rising from one‚Äôs seat up to the point of not touching or moving the object, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one is motivated by compassion and lets go of the object and so forth, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phyir nur du 'gro bas rku na phri ba'i gom pa re re la nyes byas re re 'o //
analyzed: phyir nur du 'gro bas rku na phri ba'i gom pa re re la nyes byas re re 'o //
translated: If one steals by going backward, there is an offense of wrong conduct for each step.

original: gru phur ba las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin pas nyes byas so //üîΩmchod pa'i don nyid du sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung rku na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gru phur ba las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin pas nyes byas so // mchod pa'i don nyid du sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung rku na nyes byas so //
translated: If one frees the object by pulling it out of the ground, since one does not touch the boat, there is an offense of wrong conduct.üîΩIf one steals a Buddha image for the purpose of worship, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: grangs la dor byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: grangs la dor byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one steals a Buddha image for the purpose of worship, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: shod thabs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma phyis pa dang bsnan pa dang gnas gzhan du gzhag pa yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: shod thabs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma phyis pa dang bsnan pa dang gnas gzhan du gzhag pa yang nyes byas so //
translated: It is also a minor offense to change the words, to add to them, or to place them in a different place.

original: rnyed pa'i tshogs gzhan du bgrang ba dang snga phyi bsnyon pa dang mi dbang bar dbang bar sgrogs pa dang kha rku na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i tshogs gzhan du bgrang ba dang snga phyi bsnyon pa dang mi dbang bar dbang bar sgrogs pa dang kha rku na nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense to count the gains of others as one‚Äôs own, to deny one‚Äôs own gains, to boast of one‚Äôs own gains, or to steal the gains of others.

original: sho gam 'dral bar bsgo ba dang / lam gzhan ston na nyes byas so //
analyzed: sho gam 'dral bar bsgo ba dang / lam gzhan ston na nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense to evade the customs, or to show others a different road.

original: mgron du ma bos par zan za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mgron du ma bos par zan za na nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense to eat without having been invited.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ji skad bstan pa de dag re re la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gcig na nyes byas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ji skad bstan pa de dag re re la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gcig na nyes byas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: For each of the downfalls that are to be discarded through application, if there is only one instance of the application, there is only one minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba tha dad na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba tha dad na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are many instances of the application, there are many minor offenses.

original: ltung ba med pa ni sku sems med pa la ltung ba med do//
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni sku sems med pa la ltung ba med do//
translated: There is no downfall if the person is not a fully ordained monk, or if the person is not capable of understanding the words.

original: snying rjes rdzu 'phrul gyis phrogs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: snying rjes rdzu 'phrul gyis phrogs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one uses supernormal powers out of compassion.

original: gos tha na ba lang gi lci ba btsir bas kyang kha bsgyur ba dang / kha tshar dang phun tshar bcad pa yang sho gam gzhal mi dgos so //
analyzed: gos tha na ba lang gi lci ba btsir bas kyang kha bsgyur ba dang / kha tshar dang phun tshar bcad pa yang sho gam gzhal mi dgos so //
translated: If the cloth is dyed with cow dung, or if the fringe and the warp are cut, there is no need to pay the duty.

original: rku sems med pa la sho gam du gtogs pa'i nyes pa 'byung bar dogs par mi bya'o //üîΩsho gam gyi gnas su gzhan gyis @60a * //
analyzed: rku sems med pa la sho gam du gtogs pa'i nyes pa 'byung bar dogs par mi bya'o // sho gam gyi gnas su gzhan gyis @60a * //
translated: If one is without a thieving thought, one should not fear being guilty of a duty on goods.

original: rang gi snod du gser la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa bcug pa la thabs gzhan gyis dor bar ma grub na rang gis reg pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi snod du gser la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa bcug pa la thabs gzhan gyis dor bar ma grub na rang gis reg pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If another puts gold, etc., which are not to be touched, into one's vessel at a place where duties are collected, and if one does not throw them out by another means, there is no fault in touching them.

original: re zhig dpe bri ba'i don du glegs bam rku ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: re zhig dpe bri ba'i don du glegs bam rku ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one steals a book in order to copy it, there is no fault.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis sho gam mtshams las bzlas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis sho gam mtshams las bzlas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one crosses a frontier post by magic, there is no fault.

original: bdag nyid kyis brkus pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis brkus pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one steals from oneself, there is no fault.

original: gang bsams pa de dang 'brel pas ma bsams pa blangs pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang bsams pa de dang 'brel pas ma bsams pa blangs pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one takes what is not given, but not what one had intended to take, there is no fault.

original: chom rkun pa las sbyin bdag gi sems kyis len pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chom rkun pa las sbyin bdag gi sems kyis len pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the owner‚Äôs mind takes possession of it through the mind of the thief.

original: gsang sngags dag gis gtong ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis gtong ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one gives it away through the power of mantras.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rdzas byi bas khyer ba len pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rdzas byi bas khyer ba len pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one takes possession of an object that belongs to oneself or another, such as food, if it has been carried off by a rat.

original: rngon pa dag gis mngon par gtses par gyur pa'i ri dags gnas khang du zhugs pa blangs pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rngon pa dag gis mngon par gtses par gyur pa'i ri dags gnas khang du zhugs pa blangs pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one takes possession of an animal that has entered one‚Äôs house and is being harmed by a hunter.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma byin par len pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang / dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad bsten par mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma byin par len pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang / dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad bsten par mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule to be implemented is this: ‚ÄúA monk should not engage in any way in the preparation, the full preparation, or the actual act of taking what was not given to him, in any place and at any time. He should train in this way.‚Äù

original: sho gam gzhal dogs pa dang bcas par 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sho gam gzhal dogs pa dang bcas par 'gro bar mi bya'o //
